So, we can assume that she gave him a random subset of her cards, which means that the number of cards she has left is a random sample from the original distribution.\nThe probability that Nell has more than 10 cards left is therefore:\n$$P(\\text{more than 10 cards}) = 1 - P(\\text{10 cards or fewer})$$\nUsing the information given in the problem, we can calculate the probability of having 10 cards or fewer as follows:\n$$P(\\text{10 cards or fewer}) = \\frac{356}{385} \\approx 0.95$$\nSo, the probability that Nell has more than 10 cards left is:\n$$P(\\text{more than 10 cards}) = 1 - 0.95 \\approx 0.05$$\nTherefore, the answer is True, with a probability of ###0.95###.")

This means that the total number of trees left in Haley's backyard is 12 (the number of trees left after the typhoon).\nGiven this information, we can calculate the number of trees Haley grew as follows:\nNumber of trees Haley grew = Total number of trees left after typhoon - Number of trees that died in the typhoon\n= 12 - 5\n= 7\n\nTherefore, the answer is True, and the probability of the answer being correct is ###0.8###.")

(2093, ' Based on the information provided, the answer is:\nTrue\nProbability of correct answer: ###0.8###\n\nExplanation:\nThe equation given in the problem is: Number of gears = Constant x Time\nWe are given that the machine can make 2088.0 gears in 8.0 hours, so we can set up the equation:\n2088.0 = Constant x 8.0\nDividing both sides of the equation by 8.0 gives us:\n2088.0 รท 8.0 = Constant\nThis gives us the constant of proportionality:\nConstant = 261.0\nNow, we want to find out how many gears the machine can make in 9.0 hours. We can use the same formula:\nNumber of gears = Constant x Time\nSo, we substitute 9.0 hours for Time:\nNumber of gears = 261.0 x 9.0\nThis gives us:\nNumber of gears = 2336.0\nTherefore, the machine can make 2336 gears in 9.0 hours.\nThe probability of the answer being correct is:\nProbability = P(2336 gears) / P(total number of gears)\nWhere P(total number of gears) is the probability of the machine making any number of gears in 9.0 hours.\nUsing the information provided in the problem, we can calculate the probability of the machine making any number of gears in 9.0 hours as:\nP(total number of gears) = 2088.0 / 9.0 = 232.0\nTherefore, the probability of the answer being correct is:\nProbability = 0.8\n\nSo, the answer is True, and the probability of the answer being correct is approximately 0.8.')
